message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.MA. 

The paper deals with the design of power and subband allocation for an OFDMA uplink system with heterogeneous packet arrivals and delay requirements. This involves modeling the problem as a Markov decision problem (MDP) and deriving a distributive online stochastic learning algorithm to estimate the per-user Q-factor and the Lagrange multipliers (LM) simultaneously. The paper also discusses the multilevel water-filling structure of the delay-optimal power control and the linear signaling overhead and computational complexity of the proposed algorithm. Based on these aspects, the likely arXiv CS sub-categories are: 

- cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper deals with the design of power and subband allocation for an OFDMA uplink system with heterogeneous packet arrivals and delay requirements. This involves modeling the problem as a Markov decision problem (MDP) and deriving a distributive online stochastic learning algorithm to estimate the per-user Q-factor and the Lagrange multipliers (LM) simultaneously. These aspects are related to information theory. 

- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper deals with the design of power and subband allocation for an OFDMA uplink system with one base station and K users. This involves considering the delay requirements of each mobile and modeling the problem as an MDP. These aspects are related to networking and internet architecture.
